name: Riad l'Orangeraie

reviews.text: Although the rooms themselves aren't that spacious, the overall place is wonderful! Rose petalled pools, flowers in vases, wonderful roof terrace. Definitely stay here. And eat dinner here at least once!
reviews.title: Great gem!

reviews.text: The Riad de L'Orangerae is quiet hideaway in a city that one may describe as overwhelming. We arrived in Marrakech and were promptly picked up and brought to the Riad where we were met at the gate by an English speaking guide. He brought us to the door and we were greeted by Cyril. The riad is stunning - large archways, polished concrete, simple and understated decorating. There are lots of spots for quiet relaxation- including near the pool and up on the roof top terrace. The staff is incredibly accomodating and were willing to help with anything we needed.
reviews.title: Perfect getaway

reviews.text: On our first evening we ate at the riad an had a fantastic meal. The breakfasts are filling and delicious, though by the time you leave you may be craving fruit. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, just be careful if you have stairs - wet polished concrete could spell disaster! The location of the riad is unbeatable - just steps from the souks which makes it easy to bring your packages back and rest a bit before making another go round. The riad is located near a Mosque so you may be awoken by calls to prayer, but I thought that just added to the whole experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, charming riad

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the riad for anyone who is looking for a nice, relaxing, and comfortable place to stay!
reviews.title: A hidden gem in the heart of the Medina
Returned from my desert trip
reviews.text: The Riad L'orangerie is simply but tastefully decorated and in a great location a few minutes walk from the Djemna El Fna (the main square). The ladies who cook and clean the riad are absolutely lovely and made us feel completely welcome. The food they cooked was as good as anything we experienced in a restaurant. The pool is clean and refreshingly cold and the roof terrace fantastic for breakfast or sunbathing.

reviews.title: Book it
reviews.text: An excellent riad with great rooms, a superb view, a fantastic position in the medina, and wonderful staff. We only booked two weeks before leaving the uk, but they were incredibly helpful and arranged accomadation at the Madada Mogodor in Esssaouira (also superb) arranged travel, and generally performed way beyond the call of duty.

I have just returned from a 5 day stay in Marrakech and loved it. The riad itself is tucked away and as with all amazing interirors is nothing to look at from the outside. You definitely need a taxi arranged to copllect you from the airport to then take you to the door or you will be wandering around for ages!
reviews.title: Perfect for everyone

description: Restored to its previous grandeur by a passionate team, this ancient Marrakech residence has been transformed into a Riad with a delightful ambiance. The seven spicy bedrooms, warm and colourful like their name, open onto two patios. The garden patio, where you can enjoy the flowers and aromatic plants while the fountain trickles in the background and the pool patio, an invitation to the art of relaxation, beside the sky blue mosaic pool.
